Interface Board

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleBoard
public interface Board
This interface defines the operations for controlling bricks, managing the game state, and retrieving game information.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ClearRow
    clearRows()
    Clears any filled rows and returns information about the cleared rows.
    boolean
    createNewBrick(int x, int y)
    Creates a new brick at the specified coordinates.
    int[][]
    getBoardMatrix()
    Returns the current board matrix representing the placed and active bricks.
    Level
    getLevel()
    Returns the current level of the player.
    Score
    getScore()
    Returns the current score of the player.
    LinesCleared
    getTotalLinesCleared()
    Returns the total number of lines cleared by the player.
    ViewData
    getViewData()
    Returns visual information required for rendering game.
    boolean
    holdBrick()
    Holds the current brick and swapping it with the previously held brick.
    void
    mergeBrickToBackground()
    Merges the current brick into the board matrix.
    boolean
    moveBrickDown()
    Moves the current brick down.
    boolean
    moveBrickLeft()
    Moves the current brick to the left.
    boolean
    moveBrickRight()
    Moves the current brick to the right.
    void
    moveGhostPiece()
    Updates the position of the ghost piece.
    void
    newGame()
    Resets the board and starts a new game.
    boolean
    rotateLeftBrick()
    Rotates the current brick to counter-clockwise.

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      boolean moveBrickDown()
      Moves the current brick down.
      Returns:
      true if the brick successfully moved; false if it cannot move further

    • moveBrickLeft

      boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Moves the current brick to the left.
      Returns:
      true if the move is successful; false otherwise

    • moveBrickRight

      boolean moveBrickRight()
      Moves the current brick to the right.
      Returns:
      true if the move is successful; false otherwise

    • rotateLeftBrick

      boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Rotates the current brick to counter-clockwise.
      Returns:
      true if the rotation is successful; false otherwise

    • holdBrick

      boolean holdBrick()
      Holds the current brick and swapping it with the previously held brick.
      Returns:
      true if the hold is successful; false otherwise

    • createNewBrick

      boolean createNewBrick(int x, int y)
      Creates a new brick at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate on the board
      y - the y-coordinate on the board
      Returns:
      true if the brick was successfully created; false otherwise

    • moveGhostPiece

      void moveGhostPiece()
      Updates the position of the ghost piece.

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current brick into the board matrix.

    • clearRows

      ClearRow clearRows()
      Clears any filled rows and returns information about the cleared rows.
      Returns:
      a ClearRow object containing cleared row data

    • getBoardMatrix

      int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Returns the current board matrix representing the placed and active bricks.
      Returns:
      a 2D integer array representing the board

    • getViewData

      ViewData getViewData()
      Returns visual information required for rendering game.
      Returns:
      ViewData object containing rendering information

    • getScore

      Score getScore()
      Returns the current score of the player.
      Returns:
      a Score object containing the player's score

    • getTotalLinesCleared

      LinesCleared getTotalLinesCleared()
      Returns the total number of lines cleared by the player.
      Returns:
      a LinesCleared containing the line count

    • getLevel

      Level getLevel()
      Returns the current level of the player.
      Returns:
      a Level containing the player's level

    • newGame

      void newGame()
      Resets the board and starts a new game.
